intro: Epilobium dodonaei f. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the evening primrose family, Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrow and hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with four petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
